commitResults.messageBody: Refactored chatbot name to Pep and implemented skeletal version
Program now waits for user input, will echo the input unless receives "bye", where it then exists.
All UI logic is in Ui class, and improved readability with Pep focusing on chatbot behavior while UI handles presentation.
Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
Add the ability to mark tasks as done. Optionally, add the ability to change the status back to not done.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: split Pep into separate classes
commitResults.messageBody: - Moved Ui, TaskList, and Task into their own files for better modularity

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: improve task output formatting in toString()
commitResults.messageBody:
Replaced direct System.out.println usage with a cleaner toString() override
that formats tasks consistently using status icon and description.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add support for Todo, Deadline task types
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented Task subclasses (Todo, Deadline) inheriting from Task
- Updated Pep to parse commands for each task type and store them polymorphically
- Enhanced UI to display task type, status, and relevant date details

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add Event task type with start and end time support
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented Event class extending Task to represent tasks with a start and end time
- Updated command parsing in Pep to handle 'event' input with /from and /to parameters
- Enhanced UI to display Event tasks with their time range

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated parser class and refactored Pep's run()
commitResults.messageBody: Parser now includes todo, deadline and event commands.
commands have been packaged and code refactored to include relevant imports
tasks, deadline, event, todo have been packaged

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Packaged ui and refactored TaskList to package task

commitResults.messageBody: AddTodoCommand class had a mistyped object of Task instead of Todo
added IllegalArgumentException to show error message when user input unusual commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated exception handling for AddEventCommand to handle missing 'from' and 'to'
Refactor: TaskList to use ArrayList for dynamic task
refactor: update markTask and unmarkTask to throw PepException
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace boolean return values with PepException for invalid task indices.
Update MarkCommand and UnmarkCommand to declare throws PepException.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add DeleteCommand to remove tasks by index
commitResults.messageBody:
Implements DeleteCommand to handle task deletion from TaskList.
Validates index bounds and throws PepException for invalid task numbers.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add DeleteCommand to remove tasks by index
commitResults.messageBody: Updates UI to display confirmation of deleted task and remaining count.
Storage class for saving files

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: implement persistent storage for task list
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Storage class to handle saving and loading tasks from disk using a
relative, OS-independent file path (./data/duke.txt). Automatically
create the data directory and file if they do not exist. Save the task
list after every modifying command (add, delete, mark, unmark) and load
existing tasks on startup. Include error handling for missing files and
corrupted data lines to ensure robustness across different environments.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(storage): prevent task list from clearing on startup
commitResults.messageBody:
Rewrite Storage.load() to correctly load tasks from existing file without
overwriting when the file is present. Add debug output to confirm file
path, skip corrupted or blank lines instead of aborting, and only create
data directory and file if missing. This ensures saved tasks persist
across chatbot restarts.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/tasks/TaskList.java

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(tasklist): restore deleteTask method to remove tasks by index
commitResults.messageBody:
Reintroduce deleteTask(int index) to TaskList, allowing removal of a task
at a given index. Method marks the task as not done before removal and
returns the removed Task. This restores previously removed functionality
needed by DeleteCommand and related features.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(parser): add support for delete command
commitResults.messageBody:
Update Parser to recognize 'delete <task number>' input and return a
DeleteCommand with the correct zero-based index. This enables users to
remove tasks from the list via the delete command, consistent with mark
and unmark parsing logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(find): implement keyword search for tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Add findTasks method in TaskList to return all tasks containing a given
keyword. Update FindCommand to use this method and Ui.showTasks to
display matching tasks with numbering. Supports multiple matches and
handles empty results gracefully.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: removed boolean return of markTask
commitResults.messageBody: Previously markTask return true or false as an error checker, now redundant due to exception handling.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add JavaDoc comments to core classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Add JavaDoc headers to Parser, FindCommand, TaskList, Storage, and Ui.
Document key public methods including parse, execute, deleteTask,
findTasks, load, save, and UI display methods. Improves readability and
maintainability by clarifying the purpose, parameters, and behavior of
major components.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: clearer parameter names for chatbot
commitResults.messageBody: welcome message was using generic 'name' as variable, refactored to chatbotName for clearer usage.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore(storage): remove redundant null check and handle mkdirs/createNewFile results
commitResults.messageBody:
Eliminate unnecessary 'task != null' check in Storage.load since parseTask
never returns null. Add explicit handling of File.mkdirs() and
File.createNewFile() return values to acknowledge success or failure and
suppress IDE warnings. Improves code clarity and robustness.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add user guide for Pep chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Create docs/README.md with a concise user guide. Includes quick start
instructions, feature descriptions with examples, summary table of
commands, and FAQ. Provides enough detail for new users to use all
important features while keeping the guide short and user-friendly.

Introduce parseIndex helper in Parser to handle integer argument parsing
for mark, unmark, and delete commands. Ensures consistent error handling,
usage messages, and prevents crashes on invalid input. Removes duplicate
try/catch logic across commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(ui): improve error display and integrate with index validation
commitResults.messageBody:
Update Ui.showError to display PepException messages in a consistent
boxed format. Refactor MarkCommand, UnmarkCommand, and DeleteCommand to
use TaskList.validateIndex for bounds checking, ensuring invalid task
numbers are handled gracefully without crashing the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs(readme): fix invalid YAML front matter in User Guide
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove incorrect '---' markers from docs/README.md that caused Jekyll
build to fail. The file now begins directly with Markdown content
(`# Pep Chatbot â€“ User Guide`). Ensures compatibility with GitHub Pages
and prevents invalid YAML parsing errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs(tasks): add JavaDoc and LocalDate/LocalDateTime support for Deadline and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Add comprehensive JavaDoc to Deadline and Event classes. Refactor Deadline
to store due dates as LocalDate and Event to store start/end times as
LocalDateTime. Input accepted in ISO-like formats (yyyy-MM-dd, yyyy-MM-dd HHmm)
and displayed in user-friendly formats (e.g., Oct 15 2019, Dec 02 2019 18:00).

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(storage): support ISO date/time serialization for Deadline and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Update formatTask to save LocalDate and LocalDateTime in ISO format.
Update parseTask to reconstruct Deadline and Event from these values.
Revise User Guide examples for deadline and event commands to use
yyyy-MM-dd and yyyy-MM-dd HHmm input formats, displayed as
MMM dd yyyy and MMM dd yyyy HH:mm.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs(userguide): update deadline and event formats to use ISO date/time
commitResults.messageBody:
Revise User Guide examples for deadline and event commands to accept
yyyy-MM-dd and yyyy-MM-dd HHmm input formats. Update displayed output
examples to show user-friendly formats (MMM dd yyyy, MMM dd yyyy HH:mm).
Ensures documentation matches new LocalDate/LocalDateTime implementation.
Merging PRs:
